intro: Cincinalis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty cincinalis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Cincinalis ferruginea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be found in botanical gardens and private collections.
